SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
App
JavaFX Application class
BaseScene
A Base Scene used in the game.
BlockClickedListener
The Block Clicked listener is used to handle the event when a block in a GameBoard is clicked.
ChallengeScene
The Single Player challenge scene.
CommunicationsListener
The Communications Listener is used for listening to messages received by the communicator.
Communicator
Uses web sockets to talk to a web socket server and relays communication to attached listeners YOU DO NOT NEED TO WORRY ABOUT THIS CLASS! Leave it be :-)
Game
The Game class handles the main logic, state and properties of the TetrECS game.
GameBlock
The Visual User Interface component representing a single block in the grid.
GameBlockCoordinate
Represents a row and column representation of a block in the grid.
GameBoard
A GameBoard is a visual component to represent the visual GameBoard.
GameEndListener
The GameEndListener listens to when the game has ended and handles what happens afterwards
GameLoopListener
The GameLoopListener listens to when the game has to loop (when the timer runs out) and syncs the UI timer to the game timer
GamePane
The Game Pane is a special pane which will scale anything inside it to the screen and maintain the aspect ratio.
GamePiece
Instances of GamePiece Represents the model of a specific Game Piece with it's block makeup.
GameWindow
The GameWindow is the single window for the game where everything takes place.
Grid
The Grid is a model which holds the state of a game board.
InstructionsScene
The instructions scene will display all the pieces as they are dynamically generated and show the controls for the game.
Launcher
This Launcher class is used to allow the game to be built into a shaded jar file which then loads JavaFX.
Leaderboard
This component is used to display players scores in the multiplayer part of the game
LineClearedListener
The LineClearedListener listens to when a line is cleared and handles what happens
LobbyScene
The lobby scene is used to show available multiplayer channels which can be joined or created.
MenuScene
The main menu of the game.
Multimedia
The multimedia class handles multimedia files such as audio files and their execution.
MultiplayerGame
The MultiplayerGame class handles the main logic of the multiplayer part of the game.
MultiplayerGameEndListener
The MultiplayerGameEndListener listens to when the game has ended and handles what happens afterwards
MultiplayerScene
The MultiplayerScene functions similar to the ChallengeScene but has some slight changes to make it more suitable for multiplayer playing.
NextPieceListener
The NextPieceListener handles the event when a new piece needs to be displayed on a PieceBoard
PieceBoard
A PieceBoard is used to display a piece
ReceiveMessageListener
The ReceiveMessageListener interface provides a method that will handle the change of the text element in a scene based off of the received message from the server
RightClickedListener
The RightClickedListener is used to handle the way that a right click is treated
ScoreChangedListener
The ScoreChangedListener listens to when the score of the player has changed and carries out the needed checks relating to the highs-core
ScoresList
This component will display a list of scores
ScoresScene
This scene displays the locally saved scores and the current score if it is higher than the locally stored ones
